captions.text:
- By the way, your
penmanship is pretty good.
- Great kinda compliment.
(laughing)
- Maybe it's like the overzealous guy
who like always slaps people on the ass
like when they've done a good job.

- Why you gotta give the
gay man the butt shark sign?
- So instead of saying bullshit,
they say, "That's butt shark."

- Butt shark sounds like
something my ex-boyfriend
used to try sometimes (laughing).

- Butt shark is the Dudley
Do-Right sailor, brown noser
who makes everyone else look bad.
- Also known as Bravo Fox Trot.

- AKA Bravo Fox Trot
- (all laughing)
- It's a classic treat on base.

A chilli dog with shredded
mozzarella on top.

- I think a devil dog is
when a random street dog

in a foreign country approaches
you and attaches to you
and you fall in love with that dog.

- Last time I checked,
a devil dog was like one
of those little Hostess snacks.
(incorrect buzzer rings)

- This sexy marine
right here is devil dog.
- Oorah.

- This mildly attractive marine
over here is a devil dog.
- AKA Two Four Hundred.
- The battle of Belleau Wood?

- The Germans described
marines in the fight

as teufel hunden which
stands for hell hounds.
That's where they got the name devil dog.

- Be like, oh, I need
someone to snipe that person.

Oh, don't worry, the
silver bullet's got it.
- Is our military fighting werewolves?

- A sliver bullet is like a
bullet but it's a smaller one.
- A bullet made of silver or a sex toy.
- Silver bullet is if you're
in combat fighting werewolves.
Did Eugene already make that joke?
- There you go, that's my dog right there.
- We all had those at least once.
- Hell no, what you talking about?
- Exhaustion, stroke, dehydration,

we have to go get the
temperature to make sure
it wasn't heat stroke through the rectum.
- You don't want to be a heat casualty
because you get the silver bullet.

- That's the prison that people
go to if they've been bad
in the military.

- The void where all the mail
goes to from your loved ones
that you don't find for like six months.
- Think the suck is cleaning toilets?
- Is this just being in the military?
Like, oh yeah, what suck were you in?
I was in the first Iraq suck.
(bell rings)
Because war sucks right?
We're all on board with that.
- I enlisted in the suck as a 17 year old.
It has its up and downs.

Couldn't wait to get
the fuck out of there.
Salute to the current marines serving
at home and abroad.
- I saw the suck from a distance.
(all laughing)

I was there for it so
I didn't have to deal
with the suck very much.

- If you didn't know, the
suck is your enlistment

or more commonly known
as Iraq and Afghanistan.

- There's bunk beds and
they're the ones that have
to sleep in the middle bunk.
- Is it like a midwife for rats?

- Midrats are the people
who are like in the middle

of the ship and they don't
get to see the sunlight.

- He's in the middle rank,
he shouldn't be in that rank
so he's a midrat.

- Military's 24/7 so you
gotta feed the guys that are
up at night.
- Midnight rations.
- Thank you.
(all laughing)
- Or midrats, midrats.
- We get it military.

You have a bunch of cool words
that we don't get to say.

With sharks and bullets
and tough people stuff.
Kay, what did you wanna ask me?

comments.text:
And that, boys and girls, doesn't even scratch the surface of all the 
military slang in use today. Never mind the near-infinite number of 
acronyms--which can differ from service to service, and from active duty to 
reserves--until the whole thing turns into a number of foreign languages.﻿

clap. You got 4 silver bullets at a time. Two High and Two Low in the

:) ).﻿

comments.text:
Fun fact: The teufel hunden name that Germans gave the marines was because 
they would swear they shot a marine (and usually did) but they would get 
back up and keep fighting and so they thought they were "devil dogs".﻿

comments.author: Hl Lopez

comments.text:
Teufel Hunden is definitly not a nickname given by germans. its 
gramatically incorrect and we write words like that in a wordchain so no 
space or capital letters in the mid. the word would be "Teufelshunde" but 
why would they call them that when the exisiting equivalent word for 
devildogs is "Höllenhunde"?﻿
